Package chess

Class Board

java.lang.Object
chess.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
Encapsulates the 8*8 chess board that holds the game piece

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Board()
    Initializes the board and populates it with initial pieces

    Modifier and Type Method Description

    Gets the board dimension

    Checks if a position is within the boundaries of the board
    void nullLocation​(char col, int row)
    Makes the desired location null on the board
    void printBoard()
    Prints the complete board with the '##' and current pieces in their respective locations
    void setPiece​(Piece piece)
    Adds a piece to the board based on the piece's location

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      Prints the complete board with the '##' and current pieces in their respective locations

      public int getDimension()
      Gets the board dimension
      Returns:
      int - Dimension

    • inBounds

      public boolean inBounds​(char col, int row)
      Checks if a position is within the boundaries of the board
      Parameters:
      col - Character representing the column
      row - Row number
      Returns:
      boolean - true if location is contained in the board, false otherwise

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece​(char col, int row)
      Gets the piece at specified location
      Parameters:
      col - Character representing the desired column
      row - Row number
      Returns:
      Piece - Piece at desired location

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece​(Piece piece)
      Adds a piece to the board based on the piece's location
      Parameters:
      piece - Piece that needs to be added to the board

    • nullLocation

      public void nullLocation​(char col, int row)
      Makes the desired location null on the board
      Parameters:
      col - Character representing the column
      row - Row number

    • getPiecesByColor

      public java.util.List<Piece> getPiecesByColor​(char color)
      Obtains the pieces on the board of a specified color
      Parameters:
      color - Color of the pieces ('w'/'b')
      Returns:
      List - List of all the pieces of the desired color
